computer: A machine that can follow instructions and do math really fast!
code: Instructions written in a special language that computers can understand
program: A set of instructions that tells a computer what to do
bug: A mistake in a computer program that makes it not work right
internet: A way for computers all over the world to talk to each other
variable: A box that holds information in a program, like a number or word
function: A chunk of code that does a specific job and can be used over and over
loop: Instructions that repeat over and over until they're told to stop
algorithm: Step-by-step instructions for solving a problem
python: A programming language that's easy to learn and fun to use!
robot: A machine that can move and do tasks by following a program
data: Information stored in a computer, like numbers, words, or pictures
memory: Where a computer stores information so it can remember things
keyboard: The part of the computer you type on with buttons for letters and numbers
mouse: A device you move around to point and click on things on the screen
screen: The part of the computer that shows you pictures and words
file: A collection of information saved on a computer with a name
folder: A place to organize and store files together
save: To store your work on the computer so you don't lose it
open: To load a file so you can see it and work with it
